column5: Just got word yesterday that a fire broke out by Wine Lake Camp on the Anishinabi River. Owner has a worker in camp and noticed the fire and called the MNR. They had to bring in water planes to put it out. Is it that dry in Ontario? I know this lake system is really low by pictures I have seen. Be safe up north.
Very dry.had a heck of a t storm last night in the area Power out all night but got some rain to.Hopefully no new fires with the light show.

The Ontario MNR Forest Fire Info Map shows where all the current fires are and has a layer that shows the fire "danger rating." Currently, the further north you go the better the situation but a lot of the area is in the "moderate" to "extreme" range.
Scott, I am not sure if you read the post from Nick, but some heroic actions took care of the fire and saved Wine Lake Camp. Paradise is there just waiting for the border to open!
